```{r}
# Librerie
library(here)
library(ggplot2)

# Caricamento Dataset
data <- read.csv(here("dataset/dataMod.csv"), sep = ",", header = TRUE, check.names = FALSE)
data$Debtor <- factor(data$Debtor, levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("NO", "YES"))
data$Scholarship_holder <- factor(data$Scholarship_holder, levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("NO", "YES"))
data$Tuition_fees_up_to_date <- factor(data$Tuition_fees_up_to_date, levels = c(0, 1), labels = c("NO", "YES"))


# Funzione per raggruppare categorie con bassa frequenza
group_low_freq_categories <- function(column, threshold) {
  column <- na.omit(column)
  
  freq_table <- prop.table(table(column)) * 100
  
  if (length(freq_table) <= 2) {
    return(factor(column))
  }
  
  low_freq_categories <- names(freq_table[freq_table < threshold])
  
  if (length(low_freq_categories) == 0) {
    # Nessuna categoria con bassa frequenza
    return(factor(column))
  }
  
  grouped_column <- ifelse(column %in% low_freq_categories, 
                           "Other", 
                           as.character(column))
  
  unique_categories <- unique(grouped_column)
  ordered_categories <- c(setdiff(sort(unique_categories), "Other"), "Other")
  
  return(factor(grouped_column, levels = ordered_categories))
}

# Seleziona Fattori Socio-Economici
features_to_analyze <- c("Mothers_qualification","Fathers_qualification", "Mothers_occupation", "Fathers_occupation", "Scholarship_holder", "Debtor", "Tuition_fees_up_to_date")
target <- "Target"

low_freq_threshold <- 2

# Funzione per creare Grouped Barplot
create_grouped_barplot <- function(feature, target, data, threshold, colors) {
  las <- 1
  if(feature == "Course"){
    las <- 2
    threshold <- 0
  }
  
  data[[paste0(feature, "_grouped")]] <- group_low_freq_categories(data[[feature]], threshold)
  
  
  # Tabella di contingenza
  contingency_table <- table(data[[target]], data[[paste0(feature, "_grouped")]])
  
  # Frequenza relativa
  relative_freq_table <- prop.table(contingency_table, margin = 2) * 100
  max_percent <- max(relative_freq_table)
  
  cleaned_feature_name <- gsub("_", " ", feature)
  
  pdf_filename <- paste0("Grafici/Grouped_Barplot_Target_", gsub(" ", "_", cleaned_feature_name), ".pdf")
  
  # Salvataggio in PDF
  # pdf(pdf_filename)
  
  # Creazione del barplot
  barplot_relative <- barplot(relative_freq_table, 
                               beside = TRUE, 
                               main = paste("Grouped Barplot:", cleaned_feature_name, "/", target),
                               xlab = cleaned_feature_name, 
                               ylab = "Frequenza Relativa (%)", 
                               col = colors,
                               ylim = c(0, max_percent * 1.4), # Maggiore spazio sopra le barre
                               las = las)
  
  num_categories <- ncol(relative_freq_table) # Numero di categorie
  
  # Aggiungi percentuali sopra le barre solo se ci sono meno di 6 categorie
  if (num_categories < 6) {
    text_size <- ifelse(num_categories <= 3, 0.8, 0.6) # Adatta la dimensione delle label
    
    for (i in seq_len(nrow(relative_freq_table))) {
      for (j in seq_len(ncol(relative_freq_table))) {
        text(x = barplot_relative[i, j], 
             y = relative_freq_table[i, j] + (max_percent * 0.05), # Offset aumentato
             labels = sprintf("%.1f%%", relative_freq_table[i, j]), 
             cex = text_size, 
             col = "black")
      }
    }
  }
  
  # Aggiunta della legenda
  legend("top", inset = c(0, -0.01), 
         legend = rownames(relative_freq_table), 
         fill = colors, 
         xpd = TRUE, horiz = TRUE)
  
  # dev.off()
}

color_palette <- c("#FF6A6A", "#32CD32", "#6495ED")

# Creazione Barplot Fattori Socio-Economici / Target
for (feature in features_to_analyze) {
  create_grouped_barplot(feature = feature, 
                         target = target, 
                         data = data, 
                         threshold = low_freq_threshold, 
                         colors = color_palette)
}


```



```{r}
create_boxplot <- function(feature, target, data, colors) {
  cleaned_feature_name <- gsub("_", " ", feature)
  
  # Creazione del boxplot
  p <- ggplot(data, aes_string(x = target, y = feature, fill = target)) +
    geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE,
                 outlier.color = "darkblue",
                 outlier.shape = 1,
                 width = 0.6) +
    stat_boxplot(geom = "errorbar",
                 width = 0.2,
                 color = "black") +
    labs(title = paste("Boxplot:", cleaned_feature_name, "/", target),
         x = target,
         y = cleaned_feature_name) +
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", vjust = 2),
          legend.position = "none")
  
  pdf_filename <- paste0("Grafici/Boxplot_Target_", gsub(" ", "_", cleaned_feature_name), ".pdf")
  # pdf(pdf_filename)
  
  # Mostra il grafico
  print(p)
  
  # dev.off()
}

# Sottoinsieme di feature da analizzare
features_to_analyze <- c("Unemployment_rate", "Inflation_rate", "GDP")
target <- "Target"

# Creazione dei Boxplot per ogni feature
for (feature in features_to_analyze) {
  create_boxplot(feature = feature, 
                 target = target, 
                 data = data, 
                 colors = c("#FF6A6A", "#32CD32", "#6495ED"))
}
```

```{r}
# DEBTOR
# Librerie
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(here)

# Caricamento Dataset
data <- read.csv(here("dataset/dataMod.csv"), sep = ",", header = TRUE, check.names = FALSE)

# Sostituzione dei valori numerici con le etichette corrispondenti
data$Debtor <- factor(data$Debtor, 
                      levels = c(0, 1), 
                      labels = c("No", "Yes"))

data$Target <- factor(data$Target, 
                      levels = c("Graduate", "Enrolled", "Dropout"), 
                      labels = c("Graduate", "Enrolled", "Dropout"))

# Calcolo delle frequenze relative per ciascun gruppo Debtor
freq_debtor <- data %>%
  group_by(Debtor, Target) %>%
  summarise(Count = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%
  group_by(Debtor) %>%
  mutate(Perc = Count / sum(Count) * 100)

# Definizione della palette di colori 
color_palette <- c("Graduate" = "#6495ED", "Enrolled" = "#32CD32", "Dropout" = "#FF6A6A")

# Creazione del grouped barplot
p <- ggplot(freq_debtor, aes(x = Debtor, y = Perc, fill = Target)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), width = 0.6) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = color_palette) +  
  labs(title = "Grouped Barplot: Debtor/Target", 
       x = "Debtor", 
       y = "Frequenza Relativa (%)", 
       fill = "Target") +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Perc, 1), "%")), 
            position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), 
            vjust = -0.5, 
            size = 4) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"))

# Salvataggio del grafico in PDF
ggsave("Grafici/Grouped_Barplot_Debtor_Target.pdf", plot = p, width = 10, height = 6)

```

```{r}
# GROUPED BARPLOT: MOTHERS_QUALIFICATION vs TARGET

# Librerie
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(here)

# Caricamento Dataset
data <- read.csv(here("dataset/dataMod.csv"), sep = ",", header = TRUE, check.names = FALSE)

# Convertire la variabile Target in fattore ordinato
data$Target <- factor(data$Target, 
                      levels = c("Graduate", "Enrolled", "Dropout"), 
                      labels = c("Graduate", "Enrolled", "Dropout"))

# Creazione della variabile accorpata con la nuova suddivisione
data$Mothers_qualification_grouped <- recode(data$Mothers_qualification,
                                            # 1 - Higher Education
                                            "2" = "1-Higher Education",  # Higher Education - Bachelor's Degree
                                            "3" = "1-Higher Education",  # Higher Education - Degree
                                            "4" = "1-Higher Education",  # Higher Education - Master's
                                            "5" = "1-Higher Education",  # Higher Education - Doctorate
                                            "40" = "1-Higher Education", # Higher Education - Degree (1st cycle)
                                            "41" = "1-Higher Education", # Specialized Higher Studies Course
                                            "42" = "1-Higher Education", # Professional Higher Technical Course
                                            "43" = "1-Higher Education", # Higher Education - Master (2nd cycle)
                                            "44" = "1-Higher Education", # Higher Education - Doctorate (3rd cycle)
                                            
                                            # 2 - Secondary Education
                                            "1" = "2-Secondary Education",  # Secondary Education - 12th Year of Schooling or Equivalent
                                            "18" = "2-Secondary Education", # General Commerce Course
                                            "22" = "2-Secondary Education", # Technical-Professional Course
                                            "27" = "2-Secondary Education", # 2nd Cycle of the General High School Course
                                            "39" = "2-Secondary Education", # Technological Specialization Course
                                            "6" = "2-Secondary Education",  # Frequency of Higher Education (non completato, quindi accorpato a Secondary)
                                            
                                            # 3 - Basic Education (3º ciclo)
                                            "19" = "3-Basic Education (3º ciclo)", # Basic Education 3rd Cycle (9th/10th/11th Year) or Equivalent
                                            "10" = "3-Basic Education (3º ciclo)", # 11th Year of Schooling - Not Completed
                                            "12" = "3-Basic Education (3º ciclo)", # Other - 11th Year of Schooling
                                            "14" = "3-Basic Education (3º ciclo)", # 10th Year of Schooling
                                            "9"  = "3-Basic Education (3º ciclo)", # 12th Year of Schooling - Not Completed
                                        
                                            # 4 - Basic Education (2º ciclo)
                                            "38" = "4-Basic Education (2º ciclo)", # Basic Education 2nd Cycle (6th/7th/8th Year) or Equivalent
                                            "11" = "4-Basic Education (2º ciclo)", # 7th Year (Old)
                                            "26" = "4-Basic Education (2º ciclo)", # 7th Year of Schooling
                                            "29" = "4-Basic Education (2º ciclo)", # 9th Year of Schooling - Not Completed
                                            "30" = "4-Basic Education (2º ciclo)", # 8th Year of Schooling
                                            
                                            # 5 - Basic Education (1º ciclo)
                                            "37" = "5-Basic Education (1º ciclo)", # Basic Education 1st Cycle (4th/5th Year) or Equivalent
                                            
                                            # 6 - No Qualification
                                            "35" = "6-No Qualification", # Can't Read or Write
                                            "36" = "6-No Qualification", # Can Read Without Having a 4th Year of Schooling
                                            "34" = "6-No Qualification", # Unknown
                                            .default = "6-No Qualification") # Qualsiasi valore non specificato sarà considerato senza qualifica

# Convertire in fattore con ordine predefinito
data$Mothers_qualification_grouped <- factor(data$Mothers_qualification_grouped, 
                                            levels = c("1-Higher Education", 
                                                       "2-Secondary Education", 
                                                       "3-Basic Education (3º ciclo)", 
                                                       "4-Basic Education (2º ciclo)", 
                                                       "5-Basic Education (1º ciclo)", 
                                                       "6-No Qualification"))


# Calcolo delle frequenze relative per ciascun gruppo di Mothers_qualification_grouped
freq_mother <- data %>%
  group_by(Mothers_qualification_grouped, Target) %>%
  summarise(Count = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%
  group_by(Mothers_qualification_grouped) %>%
  mutate(Perc = Count / sum(Count) * 100)

# Definizione della palette di colori

# Creazione del grouped barplot
p1 <- ggplot(freq_mother, aes(x = Mothers_qualification_grouped, y = Perc, fill = Target)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), width = 0.6) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = color_palette) +  
  labs(title = "Grouped Barplot: Mother's Qualification/Target", 
       x = "Mother's Qualification", 
       y = "Frequenza Relativa (%)", 
       fill = "Target") +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Perc, 1), "%")), 
            position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), 
            vjust = -0.5, 
            size = 4) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

freq_father <- data %>%
  group_by(Fathers_qualification_grouped, Target) %>%
  summarise(Count = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%
  group_by(Fathers_qualification_grouped) %>%
  mutate(Perc = Count / sum(Count) * 100)

# Creazione del grouped barplot
p2 <- ggplot(freq_father, aes(x = Fathers_qualification_grouped, y = Perc, fill = Target)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), width = 0.6) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = color_palette) +  
  labs(title = "Grouped Barplot: Father's Qualification/Target", 
       x = "Father's Qualification", 
       y = "Frequenza Relativa (%)", 
       fill = "Target") +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Perc, 1), "%")), 
            position = position_dodge(width = 0.7), 
            vjust = -0.5, 
            size = 4) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

# Salvataggio del grafico in PDF
ggsave("Grafici/Grouped_Barplot_Fathers_Qualification_Target.pdf", plot = p2, width = 10, height = 6)
```
